description.narrative: Sverige kommer att ge kärnstöd till IDOM, en civilsamhällsorganisation baserad i Moldavien, under perioden juni 2016 - juni 2019. Kärnstöd ges för att stärka IDOM´s organisatoriska kapacitet och för att bidra till implementeringen av deras strategiska plan 2016-2018 för att främja mänskliga rättigheter i Moldavien.

Sweden will support IDOM, a civil society organisation from Moldova, to implement core support activities provided by IDOM’s Strategic Plan and RAF during June 2016 - June 2018. Core support is granted to strengthen institutional capacities and to assist the implementation of IDOM’s medium term Strategic Plan 2016-2019 in promoting human rights in Moldova.

Sweden will support IDOM, a civil society organisation from Moldova, to implement core support activities provided by IDOM’s Strategic Plan and RAF during June 2016 - June 2019. Core support is granted to strengthen institutional capacities and to assist the implementation of IDOM’s medium term Strategic Plan 2016-2019 in promoting human rights in Moldova.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: IDOM was supported by the Swedish Embassy in Chisinau through the first core support intervention implemented in Moldova. In 2016-2019 the organisation implemented its RAF and activities to strengthen internal institutional capacities. The following positive results should be mentioned: - Based on IDOM’s complain, Constitutional Court declared unconstitutional legal provision of article 13 paragraph (1) letter b) of the Electoral Code, which provides that persons with mental disabilities declared incapable, can’t vote. In result, mentally disabled persons can vote without any legal restriction, on equal bases with all persons. – Important step on aiming the article 29 from Convention of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. - Based on IDOM’s advocacy, monitoring and evaluation activity, the Ministry of Health Labour and Social Protection has recognized that the mentally disabled persons who are placed in rigorous surveillance sections from psycho-neurological institutions are private from their freedom and assumed to take measures to close the rigorous surveillance sections in neurological boarding houses. - Several amendments to the legal framework on the rights of PLHIV were submitted and most of them accepted by the authorities, therefore IDOM the most discriminatory provisions/practices identified since 2012 included in the Result Assessment Framework of IDOMs Strategic Plan 2016-2019, were removed. As example: all restrictions on the entry and stay in Moldova of legal aliens with HIV status were lifted; the legal provisions according to which the diagnosis and disease code were indicated in the hospital certificate were repealed; the Constitutional Court declared unconstitutional the provisions according to which the medical basis was inscribed in the military certificate, according to which a person could be excluded from military records; all restrictions on the placement of HIV-positive people in social institutions were removed; discriminatory provisions regarding compulsory medical examination of young people before marriage were repealed. - Over 2,000 people living with HIV received legal consulting or have been represented by IDOM lawyers before the authorities and courts of law to secure protection of their rights and freedoms. For example due to IDOM’s work, pregnant women living with HIV are entitled to give birth in any maternity hospital in the country, having the principle of equality respected and without being subject to discrimination. - IDOM managed to contribute to ensure the respect of the right to life and health of the patients by litigating in the courts more than 10 medical malpraxis cases and by creating a wide judicial practice in this field. For example we proved malpractice in a case of a young woman who had invoked that due to a surgery, her ovaries and fallopian tubes had been removed, which caused her a serious bodily injury and loss of reproduction capacity . Also we proved the guilt and liability of the medical staff from three public medical institutions whose actions and inactions caused damages to the life and health of a mother and her son by infecting the latter with HIV ; we proved the violation of the right to life of a young women who died because of a medical error. - IDOM lawyers have helped many people with psychosocial disabilities recover their legal capacity, thus giving them the opportunity to live a fulfilled and independent life, in conditions of dignity and equality with all . IDOM started many lawsuits for the recovery of the property of persons with intellectual/psychosocial disabilities of which they had been deprived upon institutionalization and loss of legal capacity. - Under the provided trainings – based on m&e findings -more than 300 police officers and 250 employees from psychiatric institution have been aimed in fields of Human Rights, non-admitting of torture and ill-treatment;Was improved the national policies / legal framework in fields of preventing torture / ill-treatment, galvanizing safeguards and ensuring rights of mentally disabled people – e.g. provided support to authorities do develop and adopt new National Programme / Action Plan on Human Rights, minimal standards on detention in police custody, Strategy and Action Plan for deinstitutionalization the mentally disabled persons.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
